entry.title: Game Boy Owners Can Soon Convert Iconic Devices Into Secure Hardware Wallets
entry.summary:
In the near future, Game Boy owners will have the opportunity to convert their devices into a hardware wallet for cryptocurrencies. The project, known as the Game Wallet, was unveiled by Joseph Schiarizzi, a developer hailing from Keyp, a Web3 startup. By employing a physical cartridge, this innovation enables users to harness the power of their Nintendo Game Boy device as a secure cold storage wallet for crypto assets.
Keyp‚Äôs Game Wallet: Turning Game Boy Into a Secure Hardware Wallet for Cryptocurrencies
On May 19, Joseph Schiarizzi, a developer from the cryptocurrency company Keyp, unveiled a project he has crafted since the beginning of the year. Schiarizzi introduced a concept that utilizes a physical Game Boy cartridge, resulting in the creation of a ‚Äútruly offline hardware walle‚Ä¶

Amid the continuous downtrend in the non-fungible token (NFT) market trading volume, bankrupt cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) has managed to turn its financial misfortune into a remarkable success story.
According to a report published by Reuters earlier today, on Friday, Auction house Sotheby‚Äôs announced the sale of seven NFTs from the defunct firm, fetching a whooping sum of $2.5 million.¬†
Auction Of Three Arrows‚Äô NFT Assets
Among the collection of NFTs put up for auction, it was the artwork titled ‚ÄúFidenza #725‚Äù that stole the show, commanding an impressive price tag of over $1 million. entry.title: Strike Relocates Global Headquarters To El Salvador, Expands Presence To 65 Countries
entry.summary:
Bitcoin payment provider Strike has just opened more support for 65 countries. Before its expansion, Strike only operated in El Salvador, Argentina. and the US.¬†Further, the mobile app relocated its global headquarters to El Salvador from US soil.
Strike Relocates Due To Anti-Crypto Conditions In The US
The CEO and founder of Zap, the parent company of Strike, Jack Mallers, spoke with Fortune regarding the firm‚Äôs latest moves.¬†Mallers noted relocating the firm‚Äôs global headquarters to El Salvador was due to the increasing crypto regulatory conditions in the US.
Further, the CEO mentioned that the company‚Äôs expansion moves are in response to the clouded world of crypto exchanges.¬†Also, they aim to bring clarity to the concealed, unregistered licensing regimes surrounding over 1.000 di‚Ä¶

entry.title: DAO Treasuries Surge: From $8.8B to $21.5B in 90 Days, Marking a 144% Increase
entry.summary:
According to archived records, 4,833 decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) treasuries held $10.8 billion on April 15, 2022. Over the course of 309 days, by February 19, 2023, the treasuries dwindled to $8.8 billion. However, during the past 90 days, there has been a significant surge, with the funds held by DAO treasuries increasing by 144% to the current value of $21.5 billion.
Decentralized Autonomous Organizations Witness Explosive Growth in 3 Months
Following the failure of the first decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) in 2016, the concept of DAOs experienced substantial growth. As of May 19, 2023, deepdao.io, a web portal dedicated to the analysis and information surrounding these organizations, has documented approximately 12,763 DAOs. In October 2022, Bitcoin.com ‚Ä¶

Ripple Looking To Deploy $1 Billion To Expand Offerings Beyond Liquidity, CEO Says
entry.summary:
At the just-concluded Dubai Fintech Summit, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse revealed that his firm is looking to expand its services beyond liquidity provision. A prominent XRP influencer, Eri, shared the speech clip with her Twitter followers.
In the clip, Garlinghouse emphasized that the firm started as an enterprise-based cross-border settlement service provider. But now, the San Fransisco-based fintech firm is looking to evolve beyond the walls of liquidity and payment services.
Ripple‚Äôs Expansion Plans
In addition, the Ripple chief noted that blockchain has four cardinal points, including liquidity, custody, compliance, and tokenization.¬†
The CEO stressed that Ripple aspires to become more than a cross-border liquidity provider. According to Garlinghouse, Ripple is long overdue‚Ä¶

entry.title: $25K Up for Grabs as Huobi Launches Contest for Elon Musk-Supported Dogecoin (DOGE), Others
Biggest Movers: XRP Bulls Take Profits Following 6-Day Winning Streak
entry.summary:
XRP was marginally lower on Saturday, as bulls seemingly secured gains, following a recent six-day winning streak. The token, which has risen by nearly 10% in the past week, remains close to a three-week high. Polkadot remained in the green to start the weekend.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, remained close to a multi-week high to start the weekend, despite bulls moving to secure recent gains.
Following a peak at $0.4738 on Friday, XRP/USD declined to a bottom at $0.4627 earlier in the day.
Despite the decline, XRP remained close to its strongest point since April 30, when the price reached a top of $0.4818.
Looking at the chart, one of the catalysts of the move appeared to be a breakout on the relative strength index (RSI).
The index moved beyond the ceiling of 54.00, and as of writing, is now tracking at 56.09.
Bulls are likely targeting the $0.4800 mark, and could reach it this weekend, should the RSI move towards its next point of resistance at 59.00.
Polkadot (DOT)
In addition to XRP, Polkadot (DOT) extended its own gains on Saturday, as the token rose for a second straight session.
DOT/USD climbed to a high of $5.41 to start the weekend, following a low at $5.33 the day prior.
Saturday‚Äôs move comes as polkadot continued to move away from a recent support point at $5.30.
The slight increase in price has also led to the RSI moving towards resistance at 42.00, which is acting as an obstacle to further bullish pressure.
There is a good chance that DOT could make a run towards $6.00, should this current ceiling give way.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect polkadot to edge closer to $6.00 this weekend? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Shiba Inu Featured Among Tradable Tokens On Brazil-Based Digital Asset Exchange
entry.summary:
Shiba Inu (SHIB) takes center stage in the Brazilian crypto market as Digitra.com, a renowned digital asset trading platform, listed it among its tradable tokens.
This move opens up new opportunities for Brazilian crypto enthusiasts to trade and invest in the popular meme-based virtual token.
Digitra.com was founded in 2021 and has quickly established itself as a leading player in the digital asset exchange industry, offering users a wide range of cryptocurrencies.
The platform stands a chance to increase its customer base by including one of the fastest-growing cryptocurrencies in recent times. SHIB will attract crypto enthusiasts and investors in Brazil to the trading platform.
Digitra.com Introduces Shiba Inu Trades
Shiba Inu, often called the ‚ÄúDogecoin Killer,‚Äù has gained i‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC, ETH Consolidate on Saturday, Despite Optimism Fed Could Soon Pivot
entry.summary:
Bitcoin started the weekend in consolidation, as markets remained nervous despite somewhat dovish comments from U.S. Fed Chair Jerome Powell. Speaking on Friday, Powell stated that rates may not be increased by as much as initially expected. Ethereum rose marginally higher today.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) consolidated below $27,000 to start the weekend, despite dovish comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.
Following a high of $27,128.62 during yesterday‚Äôs session, BTC/USD dropped to an intraday low of $26,700.21 earlier today.
The move sees bitcoin remain relatively close to a floor at $26,300, and comes despite optimism that the Fed could soon begin to ease monetary policy.
Looking at the chart, the volatility in the market comes as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) continues to track below a key resistance level.
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 40.75, which is below a ceiling at 42.00
In order for BTC to remain firmly above $27,000, and begin to head towards $28,000, this point will need to be broken.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) on the other hand was marginally higher on Saturday, as prices remained above $1,800.
ETH/USD hit a high of $1,826.19 earlier in the day, which comes less than 24 hours after nearly dropping below $1,800.
Since dropping to a floor at $1,790 earlier in the week, ETH bulls have managed to keep price away from this point.
Similar to BTC, ethereum‚Äôs RSI continues to hover below a resistance point at 46.00, and is now at a reading of 44.84.
A breakout will also need to occur at this zone, in order for bullish momentum to fully return to ethereum.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect ethereum to surge this weekend? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: Bank of Russia Expects Significant Growth in Digital Assets Market
entry.summary:
The Central Bank of Russia predicts an increase in the issuance of digital assets, citing some of their advantages. The monetary authority has published a report presenting the progress made by the growing industry and assessing the prospects for its further development.
Russia‚Äôs Central Bank Issues Report on Market for Digital Assets
The Central Bank of the Russian Federation (CBR) expects the volume of digital financial assets (DFAs) issued in the country to increase significantly in the future. The regulator believes that growth will be facilitated by the transparency and ease of use of these alternative instruments.
According to a report quoted by the crypto page of the business news portal RBC, the bank also anticipates the emergence of new types of digital assets that will have‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin In The Spotlight: US Presidential Candidate Advocates For Regulatory Measures
entry.summary:
Bitcoin appears to be at the forefront of US politics, with several key stakeholders taking a positive stance on the leading cryptocurrency recently. The latest person to express his support for the leading currency is Robert Kennedy Jr., a Democratic candidate for the 2024 US presidential elections.
Kennedy Champions Bitcoin As A Symbol Of Democracy And Freedom¬†¬†
During the ongoing Bitcoin 2023 conference in Miami, Kennedy presented his proposals for regulating the Bitcoin (BTC) ecosystem and other cryptocurrencies. In his speech, Kennedy praised the crypto as more than just a cryptocurrency, describing it as a symbol of democracy and freedom.¬†
He argued that crypto technologies are driving innovation and criticized how the United States is stifling the industry, leading to innovati‚Ä¶

entry.title: CBDC: Canvas Executes First FX Transaction With Australian eAUD, As Trials Continue
entry.summary:
As global finance continues to evolve digitally, newer cryptocurrency products are on the rise, and central bank digital currencies (CBDC) seem to be at the center of this discussion. Australia is one of the latest countries to take advantage of the emergence of digital currencies.
The country‚Äôs plan to launch a central bank digital currency has just reached a major milestone, with blockchain startup Canvas announcing the successful use of the Australian CBDC to execute an FX (foreign exchange) transaction.
Australia Records First FX Transaction With CBDC
On Thursday, May 18, 2023, CANVAS announced its successful attempt at facilitating the first foreign exchange transaction using an Australian CBDC. The global fintech company made this known to the public through a press statement‚Ä¶

entry.title: European Commission Approves New Tax Directive For Crypto Companies
entry.summary:
The European Commission has recently approved a new tax directive for crypto companies within its jurisdiction. This directive, which encompasses a political agreement of the Council of Ministers of the European Union (EU), sets forth rules for fiscal transparency that must be adhered to by all companies facilitating cryptocurrency transactions for clients within the region.¬†
European Commission Tightens Laws On Taxation In The Crypto Industry¬†
This development marks a significant step in the European Union‚Äôs efforts to regulate the growing cryptocurrency sector. According to a press release from the Commission‚Äôs Directorate of Taxation and Customs Union, these new rules will come into effect on January 1, 2026. As a result, all crypto asset service providers (VASPs) will be required t‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
About 40% of 153 African banks surveyed by the latest African Banker annual report said they regard ‚Äúfintechs and telcos as high threats,‚Äù while 69% see artificial intelligence as the ‚Äúmost important technology shaping the industry in the near future.‚Äù According to the survey findings, only 28% of survey respondents confirmed that their respective institutions are spending more than $3 million ‚Äúon digital transformation and innovation‚Äù annually.
Fintechs Have Helped to Revolutionize Africa‚Äôs Banking Industry
According to the latest African Banker annual report, of the 153 banks that were surveyed about 40% said they ‚Äúregard fintechs and telcos as high threats.‚Äù The survey study also found that some 69% of the surveyed banks view artificial intelligence (AI) as the ‚Äúmost important techn‚Ä¶

entry.title: Tether Partners With KriptonMarket To Support USDT Acceptance In Argentina
entry.summary:
Issuer of the world‚Äôs biggest stablecoin, Tether, has struck a partnership with crypto on/off ramp platform KriptonMarket to support USDT transactions in the Central Market of Buenos Aires.
According to a statement by Tether, the collaboration with KriptonMarket will enable the market merchants to accept USDT as payment for goods while also paying their bills and a portion of employees‚Äô wages with the same stablecoin.
Tether Aims To Provide Inflation Hedge For Small Businesses
Regarded as one of Latin America‚Äôs largest fruits and vegetable markets, the Central Market of Buenos Aires is home to 900 wholesale and 50 retail businesses, employing a total labor force of 2,000 individuals.¬†
That said, the latest development by Tether is quite exciting for many of these merchants and cust‚Ä¶

Chinese Region of Guanxi to Push Digital Yuan Usage for Trading With ASEAN Nations The Chinese government is stepping up the pilot program of the digital yuan, its central bank digital currency, in a push to integrate it into trade settlements with countries of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) bloc. Zhou asserts that the recent initiatives to promote local currency settlement have provided BRICS countries with a competitive advantage in diminishing the influence of the greenback in global trade.

entry.title: ‚ÄòIn Hindsight the Metaverse Will Be Obvious and Inevitable‚Äô Says Affyn CEO Lucaz Lee
entry.summary:
Despite the many obstacles that currently make mainstream adoption seem impossible, the metaverse will eventually ‚Äúmature when gateways that form the access point for entering the myriads of metaverses come onstream,‚Äù Lucaz Lee, CEO of Affyn, has said. Lee suggested that when this point is reached, entering and exiting the metaverse will be as easy ‚Äúas ordering dinner from a takeaway app.‚Äù
Why P2E Has Not Lived Up to the Hype
Lee also said he believes augmented reality (AR), rather than virtual reality, will play a key role in the metaverse. The boss of Affyn, a play-and-earn metaverse, said this is because AR is capable of being ‚Äúseamlessly integrated into the apps we use every day.‚Äù All of this will happen with users being none the wiser.

entry.title: Gala Games Burns Over $600 Million Worth of GALA Tokens
entry.summary: Web3 startup Gala Games said that it has virtually depleted its own treasury to alleviate concerns of a future token selloff.

entry.title: Adidas Web3 Lead Thought She ‚ÄòCould Get Fired‚Äô for Signing Bored Ape Deal
entry.summary: Erika Wykes-Sneyd joins Decrypt‚Äôs gm podcast to discuss how apparel giant Adidas approaches NFTs and emerging culture alike.

entry.title: Seizing Upon Ledger Stumble, Hardware Wallet Competitors Offer Discounts
entry.summary: BitBox, Cold Card, Trezor and Blockstream all announced sale prices on their cold storage devices.

entry.title: Most Americans Consider AI a Threat to Humanity, New Poll Finds
entry.summary: A Reuters/Ipsos poll shows that 61% of Americans believe AI to be a threat to humanity.

entry.title: SEC Believes Filecoin Is a Security, Grayscale Warns Investors
entry.summary: The SEC said Grayscale has to withdraw its Filecoin Trust application because FIL is an unregistered security.

entry.title: Ron DeSantis Banned CBDCs in Florida‚ÄîThese States Could Be Next
entry.summary: The Sunshine State isn‚Äôt the only one speaking out against a potential digital dollar.

entry.title: Enter the 'Unioverse': The Cinematic Sci-Fi Game Takes Shape on Polygon
entry.summary: PREVIEW: We go hands-on with the Unioverse Proving Grounds, a flashy playtest from former Grand Theft Auto and Call of Duty developers.

entry.title: Meet Kim Asendorf: The Metallica Video Director Who Makes NFT Art Designed to Hypnotize
entry.summary: "Colors of Noise" is a series of 50 Ethereum NFT art pieces, and the pixelated waveforms could "disturb" viewers, Kim Asendorf tells Decrypt.

entry.title: How Many Games Are Building On Solana? The Answer Might Surprise You
entry.summary: Solana Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the current state of Solana's Web3 gaming ecosystem.

entry.title: Problems With Being an 'On-Chain Purist' in Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods Cofounders Owen O'Donoghue and Damon Gura keep it real with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, sharing thoughts on game balancing and what to do when in-game assets become NFTs.

entry.title: Why Solana Won't Become A Web3 Game Publisher
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Solana's "build together" approach as well as his thoughts on crypto firms becoming game publishers.

entry.title: The State Of Web3 Gaming On Hedera
entry.summary: Hedera VP Alex Russman tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Hedera's Web3 gaming ecosystem and shares a game he's particularly excited about.

entry.title: How Mirandus is Innovating Video Game Audio
entry.summary: Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game's thoughtful approach to audio design and the technologies being built to support the MMORPG's immersive world.

entry.title: Do Gamers Hate NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks the InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O‚ÄôDonoghue about gamers and NFTs.

entry.title: gm: Avenged Sevenfold's M. Shadows on Deathbats, Fandom, and AI
entry.summary: Avenged Sevenfold lead singer Matt Sanders, aka M. Shadows, is rehearsing for the band's upcoming tour. He's also figuring out how to upend what it means to be a music fan. The band launched a Deathbats Club NFT collection in 2021. That is to say: They were early. The lead singer said it was timed to give fans a chance to get comfortable with Web3 technology ahead of the group's 2023 tour, when the NFT holders can use their Deathbats for early access to tickets. M. Shadows also talked to hosts Andrew Hayward and Stephen Graves about AI and bringing Web3 into gaming.

entry.title: Inside Mojo Melee's Lore with Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella
entry.summary: At the Game Developers' Conference, Mojo Melee Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their autobattler game and its unique characters, which are also NFTs on Polygon.

entry.title: Why 'Blair Witch' Exec Producer Kevin Foxe Is '1,000% In' on Gaming
entry.summary: "The Blair Witch Project" Executive Producer Kevin Foxe wants to avoid corporate overlords and enlighten fans of the dark "Mandala" graphic novel with a video game adaptation and NFTs across multiple blockchains.

entry.title: Gala Games Co-Founder on the Aesthetic of Mirandus
entry.summary: "When assets are overdone, they just feel a little dirty. It's not pretty to look at," shared Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games co-founder Michael McCarthy in an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Solana Games GM: Play-to-Earn Games Are DeFi Products, Not Games
entry.summary: Solana Games' General Manager Johnny Lee offers a hot take on the first generation of Web3 gaming with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Brycent's Advice For Gaming Content Creators
entry.summary: XSET's Brycent shares his advice for Web3 content creators with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, including which social media platform is best for posting content.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes of Jeremy Cowart's 'Auras' NFT Event
entry.summary: A look at the preparation behind "Auras," an event in which photographer Jeremy Cowart produced and starred in 10,000 photo-based NFTs, captured in less than 30 minutes before a live audience. Credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

entry.title: Jeremy Cowart Discusses 'Auras' Event, Live-Shooting 10,000 Photo NFTs
entry.summary: Jeremy Cowart speaks with Decrypt's Sander Lutz in Nashville ahead of the "Auras" event, in which the noted photographer live-shot 10,000 unique photo-based NFTs in less than 30 minutes. The NFTs will be released through OpenSea on May 9. Video credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

entry.title: Azra Games CEO on Putting Fun Before Web3
entry.summary: "The Web3 interfaces cannot be on the foreground of the player's initial experience," says Azra Games CEO Mark Otero.
